title: Identify Functional Groups
text: Look at the structure and identify any functional groups present. This will help determine the type of intermolecular forces.

title: Presence of -OH Group
text: Notice the -OH group in the structure. This is a key indicator for a specific type of intermolecular force.

title: Hydrogen Bonding
text: The presence of an -OH group suggests that hydrogen bonding is likely the predominant intermolecular force.

title: Compare with Other Forces
text: Consider other possible intermolecular forces like dipole-dipole and London dispersion. Compare their strength with hydrogen bonding.

title: Conclusion
text: Based on the presence of the -OH group and the strength of hydrogen bonds, determine the predominant intermolecular force.
